column5: Yesterday we decided to head to Blue Lake Provincial Park.Its open to visitors and mostly people from Winnipeg,Mb come.400 campsites so its busy.Yes wake boats and jet skis.ughhh and not normally a place i go to except to swim and hike the awesome trails.Beautifull lake though.Wife wanted to paddle board and i decided while she was doing that id see if i could get some smallies.we were going to meet a a secluded little beach people dont go to.Started off catching a 13 " smallie and figured this might be good.I cast a lot of great spots that are loaded with them and no more bass. Approximatly 1 mile of normalÄºy crazy fishing. Nothing.I probably saw 200 fish.Lake is clear to about 20 ft.had the boat in 12-15 ft.Could see them trying to get under my boat for shade.lol.I checked some areas and reefs.Saw fish all over.Had fun trying all the bass stuff.Lake has some trout also and huge walleyes which ill try at a later date and the odd muskie.Decided to meet up with my wife and do a bit of swimming.Still in upper 30c.here.to hot.
I'm sure many of your WC fans were hoping for a picture of you in your Speedo....
I gave up on Speedos 30 years ago
Speedo?there isn't anyone around shed the clothes and dive in
You probably motored passed me lounging on my dock wearing my "budgie smuggler"
Spending time on the beach there with the wife and kids is a fond memory, beautiful place.
Definately picked a nice day.Park is pretty busy.Nice to get away from the crowd at far end.
